choices.answer: Writing information about a main topic or idea in your own words.
Copying and pasting a piece of text and claiming it as your idea.

questions.question: Observations explain the reasons why something is occuring.

choices.answer: The things you change in an experiment.
What you're measuring in an experiment.
The things that stay the same in the experiment.

questions.question: A statement that describes something using the 5 senses.
Which of the following is NOT acceptable when it comes to plagiarism in science writing?

choices.answer: Putting information in your own words

questions.question: "How does the amount of sun affect how tall the plant grows?" Which part of the question in the IV?

choices.answer: How does the amount of sun affect how tall the plant grows?

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an inference?

choices.answer: The rock sank to the bottom of the tank.
The rock floated in the tank.
The rock sank because it might be denser than the water.

questions.question: The dependent variable is the thing you are measuring in an experiment.
